derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a noun in the obsolete sense 'liquor'): of unknown origin

entry.def: If you swig a drink, you drink it from a bottle or cup quickly and in large amounts.

example.ex: I swigged down two white wines...
example.tran: 我把两杯白葡萄酒一饮而尽。

example.ex: He was still hanging around, swigging the Coke out of the can.
example.tran: 他还在闲逛，拿着一罐可乐大口大口地喝着。

sentences.sentence: "he finished it at a single gulp"

means.word_mean: 1. strike heavily, especially with the fist or a bat;

sentences.sentence: "He slugged me so hard that I passed out"

means.word_mean: 2. to swallow hurriedly or greedily or in one draught;

example.en: He nearly swigged the whole bottle before he needed to take a breath.
example.zh: 他几乎一口气把整瓶酒喝了下去。

sentences.en: She had a quick swig of water and then set off again.
sentences.cn: 她匆忙喝了一大口水，然后又出发了。
